guideline: Use Times New Roman font, 10pt size for the main body text. The document must be formatted in a two-column layout.
Level 1 headings should be uppercase, centered, and numbered with Roman numerals. Level 2 headings should be italicized, left-aligned, and numbered with capital letters.
References must be numbered sequentially in square brackets, e.g., [1]. The reference list should be ordered by appearance in the text.
Use margins of 1 inch on all sides. The text should be double-spaced throughout the manuscript, including the reference list. Preferred font is Times New Roman 12pt or Calibri 11pt.
Level 1 headings must be centered, bold, and title case. Level 2 headings must be flush left, bold, and title case.
Citations in text should use the author-date format (e.g., Smith, 2023). The reference list must be arranged alphabetically by the authors' last names and use a hanging indent.
The manuscript should be compiled in a single column layout unless specified otherwise by the specific journal. Standard font is Times 10pt.
Primary headings should be bold and left-aligned. Decimal numbering scheme is frequently used for sections, e.g., 1, 1.1, 1.1.1.
Reference style varies by discipline (Math/Phys vs Life Sciences). As a general baseline, use numbered citations for physics/math, and name-year citations for life sciences.
